name: ABBA The Museum
description: An interactive museum celebrating the music and legacy of the Swedish pop group ABBA.

name: ArkDes (Swedish Centre for Architecture and Design)
description: Explores contemporary and historical architecture and design in Sweden.

name: Fotografiska
description: A renowned museum showcasing cutting-edge photography from around the world.

name: Hallwyl Museum
description: A historic house museum displaying the opulent home of the Hallwyl family from the early 20th century.

name: Historiska Museet (The Swedish History Museum)
description: Covers Swedish history from the Stone Age to the present with extensive archaeological exhibits.

name: Liljevalchs
description: An art gallery featuring contemporary and classic Swedish art exhibitions.

name: Moderna Museet
description: Houses a world-class collection of modern and contemporary art, including works by Picasso and Dalí.

name: Nationalmuseum
description: Sweden’s premier museum of art and design, with collections spanning centuries.

name: Nobel Prize Museum
description: Celebrates the achievements of Nobel laureates and the history of the Nobel Prize.

name: Nordiska Museet
description: Showcases Swedish cultural history, traditions, and everyday life from the 16th century onward.

name: Royal Armoury (Livrustkammaren)
description: Displays royal artifacts, costumes, and weapons from Swedish history.

name: Skansen
description: The world’s first open-air museum, featuring historic buildings and a zoo with Nordic animals.

name: Spritmuseum (Museum of Spirits)
description: Explores the history and culture of alcoholic beverages in Sweden.

name: Stadsmuseet (Stockholm City Museum)
description: Chronicles the history and development of Stockholm through interactive exhibits.

name: Tekniska Museet (National Museum of Science and Technology)
description: Offers hands-on exhibits on science, technology, and innovation.

name: The Swedish Holocaust Museum
description: Dedicated to the memory of Holocaust victims and Sweden’s role during WWII.

name: The Viking Museum (Vikingaliv)
description: An immersive experience of Viking life with historical artifacts and reconstructions.

name: Vasa Museum
description: Home to the preserved 17th-century warship Vasa, a marvel of maritime history.

name: Bonniers Konsthall
description: A contemporary art space showcasing innovative works by Swedish and international artists.

name: Judiska Museet (The Jewish Museum)
description: Documents the history and culture of Jewish life in Sweden.

name: Medeltidsmuseet (Medieval Museum)
description: Explores Stockholm’s medieval past with artifacts and reconstructions beneath the city.

name: Naturhistoriska Riksmuseet (Swedish Museum of Natural History)
description: Features extensive natural history exhibits, including dinosaurs and geological displays.

name: Skokloster Castle
description: A Baroque castle with a museum of historic interiors, weapons, and art near Stockholm.

name: Tensta Konsthall
description: A community-focused gallery presenting contemporary art in Stockholm’s suburbs.
